author: brerrabbit3
title: ProofSpace x Argus - IDs 4 NFTs
description: There's no scalable, high assurance way to verify whether NFT projects are legitimate. And as a result, NFT market participants and artists suffer losses from NFT scams and plagiarized NFTs.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is related to the challenge of extending high assurance to verify the legitimacy of an NFT project and a problem to be solved in this challenge. People participating in the NFT often suffer from scams on stealing NFT ideas. This problem solves some of the questions of the final separation. The solution is defined through a combination of ProofSpace & Argus DID it is built on top of the Cardano comprehensive solution platform. The solution solves the problems of the industry's most scalable challenge to verify the legitimacy of NFT projects and the authenticity of the NFT. Regarding risks, the author has also mentioned possible risks in this proposal and they also list ways to overcome that risks.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposed work completion timeline is reasonable for June and July: design workflow and carries out R&D (the assigned work must be 70% complete). September: social accounts, email, phone Certificate of authenticity. (ProofSpace). October: integration with ArgusNFT via webhooks. Set up and test the flow. November: RnD public login, integration with Mining Platform via webhooks. Set up and test the flow. December: integration with Marketplace via webhooks. Set up and test the flow. The goals are clearly stated by the author. Success is well-described for Proofspace and Argus' DID solutions, and the combination of the two can improve confidence levels in NFT markets giving participants a better overview. We can see the details of the Poc workflow through this link: https://miro.com/app/board/uXjVOpvimLc=/. Our teams at ProofSpace and ArgusNFT believe that if credentials like these are generated and included in the NFT's metadata as they are minted, it will greatly reduce the ability of those to exploit the NFT market. thieves and scammers. This solution effectively solves the challenge.
f6_assessments.q2: Regarding the metrics to monitor the success of the project, we also realize that the author has listed all the indicators that need attention. Given the platform's goals, we were able to have several NFT-specific specifications. Workflows work well for Argus NFT, creators, mint platforms, and marketplaces, including integrating with existing and third-party systems. This proposal has proven to have a strong team without a doubt of the experience of propagandists, all of whom are excellent professionals. who we can follow through their LinkedIn, Twitter, Github, and YouTube.. links. The author has brainstormed this suggestion and almost all of the people who come up with it have a related background. ProofSpace is a multi-network identity platform, wrapped with codeless tools to build and scale a decentralized ID ecosystem and workflow. This is a solid team of professionals with good leadership, with the experience of the team and the solutions they provide being objective and workable showing that the authors are serious about their challenge. The funding budget is $37,411 less than 20% of the total challenge funding. The author also clearly details the items that need to be spent, they are broken down into reasonable expenditures. This proposal is a brand new project and is awaiting funding.

f6_assessments.q0: Proponent raises the issue NFT participants are often scammed about stealing NFT ideas. The solution offered is the Combination of ProofSpace & Argus DID protocol to verify the legitimacy of NFT projects and the authenticity of the NFT. If this proposal is successfully implemented it will contribute to the positive attention and NFT adoption of Cardano. So it's perfectly suited to the goal of the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: it is proposed to provide an activity plan from June to December 2022. The corresponding roadmap for each month has the content of work. However, it is not specific. it should be listed in more detail such as R&D what content what content to achieve and how much time it takes. or the "Social account, email, phone" section, specifically, what to do in 1 month but only set up a social account or email is clearly unreasonable. so I asked for a more specific plan. Next on budget it is listed into subsections. However, as mentioned above, the content of the work is not clear, so I do not have enough information to evaluate the reasonableness of the required budget. About the team they provide members and each person's job position the links prove their experience is suitable to implement the proposal. From the information available I rate the feasibility of this proposal as 4 stars.
f6_assessments.q2: The proponent provided a way to track the progress of the proposal and clearly defined what success looked like. however, if it is possible to provide more specific quantitative information and provide links to the address of the monthly reports for the community to check, the auditability of the proposal will be more complete. so I give 4 points for audibility.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal intends to develop a proof of concept that will eliminate or put an end to the fake NFTs, plagiarism and counterfeit of NFT within the cardano ecosystem and across blockchains in future. The collaboration of the two platforms: proofspce and Argusnft leading to the combination of invaluable features to ensure that NFTs can be integrated with history of minting, Self Sovereign Identity and Decentralized Identity protocols thus ensuring foolproof identification of genuine creators and collectors' ownership of NFTs. The proponents has acknowledged some relevant risk factors and possible potential solutions to mitigate the risk accordingly. This proposal definitely meets the goals of the challenge settings and it endeavors to bring sanity in Cardano ecosystem's minting of NFTs and it's marketplace thwreby making Cardano, a safe and enabling environment for NFT projects and thus a greater adoption of the Blockchain.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal has explicitly articulated it's process and modalities to achieve its set goals. The partnerships of Proofspace and  Argusnft platforms and their indepth showcase of their past achievements and products,  experience and technical competence testifies to their capacity to deliver the proposal. The Milestones and/or Roadmaps were explicitly articulated in relations with the specified timeframe. The budget estimates were provided accordingly except that it looked vague without sufficient basis for arriving at the figures in the budget. Am confident that the proposal is in good hands for a successful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal provided information on how the project should be monitored and reviewed for its performance and progress. However, these metrics are not quantifiable and/or measurable with no information where to assess the proposal's progress for the community to effectively verify the status of the proposal during to its stages of development if eventually funded.

f6_assessments.q0: Very good, the idea is to create a protocol that can unite existing technologies (ProofSpace and Argus DID protocol) to work on the detection of spoofed NFTs. Unfortunately nowadays the scams and losses related to the NFT market are only growing more and more, due to the fact that the market is becoming more popular, which makes room for malicious actors. In other words, it is very necessary that a project that seeks scalable and comprehensive solutions for this sector be carried out, in order to guarantee the legitimacy of NFT projects for all those involved. This can be a big draw for the Cardano ecosystem, as one of the biggest fears people have when getting involved with the crypto world is losing money through the drop in cryptocurrency value or through this type of scam. For these reasons I think the idea is very necessary and could generate a dApp of high value in our ecosystem, having a very relevant impact.
f6_assessments.q1: The activities are not divided on the basis of months, nor do they have an adequately detailed level of detail. For example in June and July, we know that the workflow design and implementation R&D would need to be about 70% complete. But how? What small actions would be necessary to achieve this scenario? The expense part is also not so clear. Although we were told the basics of how the requested money would be used, it still could have been explained better because some parts cost the asking amount. Why does the issuance of verifiable credentials cost around $5,000? The professionals involved, Nick, Viktor and etc, are presented very richly, I believe this is in fact the best part of the topic. We know enough about them to convey trust.
f6_assessments.q2: Where would the monthly reports promised to carry out the auditability of progress be delivered? How can we learn about the progress of the project's creations, such as the “Pilot collection minted with DIDs according to ArgusNFT and ProofSpace. Hold meetings with the main NFT markets in Cardano”? I think it lacked a bit of specificity about how this information would be demonstrated to the Cardano community. Success is defined at various points, but the same is true: it is not clear how the end results will be demonstrated to us. Parts like “Completion of the PoC combining ProofSpace's codeless DID platform with the Argus API - in a way that complies with any NFT/DID standards that emerge from the conversations (...)” need to be better informed to the community.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem with the proposal is that there is currently no scalable, highly secure way to verify if NFT projects are legit. And as a result, NFT market participants and artists suffer from NFT scams and idea-stealing NFTs. To minimize the problem of tampering, the solution is to combine ProofSpace and Argus' DID protocol, building on Cardano the industry's most comprehensive, scalable solution for verifying the legitimacy of projects. NFT project and NFT authenticity. ArgusNFT is an AI-powered, fake NFT detection protocol built to solve this problem. It monitors all NFTs minted on Cardano, detects any NFTs containing identical or similar images and/or metadata, and assesses the likelihood that similar NFTs are counterfeit. Successful implementation of this project will help Cardano projects pioneer this step in the growth of the NFT market and generate a lot of positive attention and Cardano NFT adoption in the process. The problem is identified and a solution is also perfectly articulated, the proposal is suitable for the challenge.
The plus point of this proposal is that they have foreseen the risks and challenges that may be encountered and also come up with appropriate plans to be able to face/overcome them.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal provides a very good planner. The first is about the detailed roadmap of the work to be done presented in each month (from June to December) and attached a link explaining the workload. Next is the budget. The proposal requires a budget of $37,411. The requested budget is split into two parts for Proofspace $15,736 and ArgusNFT $21,675. At the same time, the budgets are divided and allocated for each specific work to be done in the project in a detailed and reasonable manner. Transparent budgets increase the level of trust and sustainability for the project. A strength of the project is the team of members involved in the project. The project information proposal has two groups of members, ProofSpace and ArgusNFT . Team members were all introduced to each person's identity, skills, experience, and qualifications and attached links so we could learn more about each member. Detailed roadmap, transparent budget, diverse professional team and extensive experience, all combine to create strengths for the success of the project.
f6_assessments.q2: A proposal has a tight workflow and is easy to follow the project. At the same time, the necessary metrics are provided satisfactorily in terms of overall. Providing information is necessary and sufficient to measure project progress. Towards the end of the product is the success of the complete PoC platform project combining ProofSpace's codeless DID platform with the Argus API; Complete PoC presentation; Display PoC for NFT guild and Cardano SSI alliance and Cardano NFT community through social networks like Q&As, Twitter Spaces, etc. ProofSpace is a diverse platform, wrapped by non-tools that are coded to build and open the work Scaling process and decentralized biological ID status. We know the benefits the proposal will bring to the community and the ecosystem. Proposals can measure progress and test well.

solution: Combining ProofSpace's DID protocol & Argus, build on Cardano the most scalable, comprehensive solution in the industry for verifying the legitimacy of NFT projects and authenticity of NFTs.
experience:
ArgusNFT's CTO is a senior AI engineer, and its team has a combined >40yrs dev experience.
ProofSpace has extensive full stack dev, product and ops experience. PRISM & Indy are integrated into Proofspace's proven decentralized ID platform.
